page.title: 06HOUSING. SOCIAL CONCERNS.
page.content: Almost all of the property in this area is privately owned.The only{ {council house}is the School House attached to Salesbury School,formerly the home of the schoolteacher. In 1985 an ambitious scheme to provide{sheltered housing}for the aged and needy of the area was completed at {Showley Court}off Ribchester Road. The flats and maisonettes have an open outlook with farmland behind and the village green,Salesbury Cricket ground and St.Peter's Church in front. With locals,and those who enjoy peace and quiet with the possibility of an excellent hostelry serving good food within 5 minutes walk,Bonney Inn,this development has proved extremely popular. There are no minority groups in the area,few unemployed,no religious or racial discriminations.A happy valley!
